verses.esv:
19   By the sweat of your face
    you shall eat bread,
  till you return to the ground,
    for out of it you were taken;
  for you are dust,
    and to dust you shall return.”
verses.kjv: 19 In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.
verses.niv: 19 By the sweat of your brow you will eat your food until you return to the ground, since from it you were taken; for dust you are and to dust you will return."

verses.esv: 7 then the LORD God formed the man of dust from the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living creature.
verses.kjv: 7 And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
verses.niv: 7 the LORD God formed the man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living being.

verses.esv: 7 and the dust returns to the earth as it was, and the spirit returns to God who gave it.
verses.kjv: 7 Then shall the dust return to the earth as it was: and the spirit shall return unto God who gave it.
verses.niv: 7 and the dust returns to the ground it came from, and the spirit returns to God who gave it.

verses.esv:
13   As a father shows compassion to his children,
    so the LORD shows compassion to those who fear him.
14   For he knows our frame;
    he remembers that we are dust.
verses.kjv: 13 Like as a father pitieth his children, so the LORD pitieth them that fear him. 14 For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.
verses.niv: 13 As a father has compassion on his children, so the LORD has compassion on those who fear him; 14 for he knows how we are formed, he remembers that we are dust.

verses.esv:
14   For he knows our frame;
    he remembers that we are dust.
verses.kjv: 14 For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.
verses.niv: 14 for he knows how we are formed, he remembers that we are dust.

verses.esv: 20 All go to one place. All are from the dust, and to dust all return.
verses.kjv: 20 All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.
verses.niv: 20 All go to the same place; all come from dust, and to dust all return.

verses.esv: 5 And wherever they do not receive you, when you leave that town shake off the dust from your feet as a testimony against them.”
verses.kjv: 5 And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.
verses.niv: 5 If people do not welcome you, shake the dust off your feet when you leave their town, as a testimony against them."

verses.esv: 14 And if anyone will not receive you or listen to your words, shake off the dust from your feet when you leave that house or town.
verses.kjv: 14 And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet.
verses.niv: 14 If anyone will not welcome you or listen to your words, shake the dust off your feet when you leave that home or town.

verses.esv: 21 Has the potter no right over the clay, to make out of the same lump one vessel for honorable use and another for dishonorable use?
verses.kjv: 21 Hath not the potter power over the clay, of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour, and another unto dishonour?
verses.niv: 21 Does not the potter have the right to make out of the same lump of clay some pottery for noble purposes and some for common use?

verses.esv: 51 But they shook off the dust from their feet against them and went to Iconium.
verses.kjv: 51 But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.
verses.niv: 51 So they shook the dust from their feet in protest against them and went to Iconium.

verses.esv:
15   all flesh would perish together,
    and man would return to dust.
verses.kjv: 15 All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.
verses.niv: 15 all mankind would perish together and man would return to the dust.

verses.esv: 11 And if any place will not receive you and they will not listen to you, when you leave, shake off the dust that is on your feet as a testimony against them.”
verses.kjv: 11 And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.
verses.niv: 11 And if any place will not welcome you or listen to you, shake the dust off your feet when you leave, as a testimony against them."

verses.esv: 27 Abraham answered and said, “Behold, I have undertaken to speak to the Lord, I who am but dust and ashes.
verses.kjv: 27 And Abraham answered and said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord, which am but dust and ashes:
verses.niv: 27 Then Abraham spoke up again: "Now that I have been so bold as to speak to the Lord, though I am nothing but dust and ashes,

verses.esv:
29   When you hide your face, they are dismayed;
    when you take away their breath, they die
    and return to their dust.
verses.kjv: 29 Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.
verses.niv: 29 When you hide your face, they are terrified; when you take away their breath, they die and return to the dust.

verses.esv:
14 The LORD God said to the serpent,

  “Because you have done this,
    cursed are you above all livestock
    and above all beasts of the field;
  on your belly you shall go,
    and dust you shall eat
    all the days of your life.
verses.kjv: 14 And the LORD God said unto the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:
verses.niv: 14 So the LORD God said to the serpent, "Because you have done this, "Cursed are you above all the livestock and all the wild animals! You will crawl on your belly and you will eat dust all the days of your life.

verses.esv: 24 The LORD will make the rain of your land powder. From heaven dust shall come down on you until you are destroyed.
verses.kjv: 24 The LORD shall make the rain of thy land powder and dust: from heaven shall it come down upon thee, until thou be destroyed.
verses.niv: 24 The LORD will turn the rain of your country into dust and powder; it will come down from the skies until you are destroyed.

verses.esv: 23 For the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.kjv: 23 For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
verses.niv: 23 For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.esv: 6 Jesus said to him, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
verses.kjv: 6 Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.
verses.niv: 6 Jesus answered, "I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.

verses.esv: 16 “For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
verses.kjv: 16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
verses.niv: 16 "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

verses.esv: 27 And just as it is appointed for man to die once, and after that comes judgment,
verses.kjv: 27 And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment:
verses.niv: 27 Just as man is destined to die once, and after that to face judgment,

verses.esv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with your might, for there is no work or thought or knowledge or wisdom in Sheol, to which you are going.
verses.kjv: 10 Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest.
verses.niv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with all your might, for in the grave, where you are going, there is neither working nor planning nor knowledge nor wisdom.

verses.esv: 14 Your offspring shall be like the dust of the earth, and you shall spread abroad to the west and to the east and to the north and to the south, and in you and your offspring shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
verses.kjv: 14 And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
verses.niv: 14 Your descendants will be like the dust of the earth, and you will spread out to the west and to the east, to the north and to the south. All peoples on earth will be blessed through you and your offspring.

verses.esv:
27   So God created man in his own image,
    in the image of God he created him;
    male and female he created them.
verses.kjv: 27 So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
verses.niv: 27 So God created man in his own image, in the image of God he created him; male and female he created them.

verses.esv: 28 And do not fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. Rather fear him who can destroy both soul and body in hell.
verses.kjv: 28 And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
verses.niv: 28 Do not be afraid of those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. Rather, be afraid of the One who can destroy both soul and body in hell.

verses.esv:
25   The wolf and the lamb shall graze together;
    the lion shall eat straw like the ox,
    and dust shall be the serpent’s food.
  They shall not hurt or destroy
    in all my holy mountain,”
      says the LORD.
verses.kjv: 25 The wolf and the lamb shall feed together, and the lion shall eat straw like the bullock: and dust shall be the serpent’s meat. They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain, saith the LORD.
verses.niv: 25 The wolf and the lamb will feed together, and the lion will eat straw like the ox, but dust will be the serpent's food. They will neither harm nor destroy on all my holy mountain," says the LORD.
